EDesktopPane

public EDesktopPane()

closeAll hides all internal frames on the desktop.

close

public void close(EInternalFrame window)
close closes the internal frame referenced by the object parameter. NOTE: This method should not be called directly! Instead, call window.setClosed(true); and the EDesktopPane will capture the event, remove the EInternalFrame from the desktop, reset the next & previous EInternalFrame references, and call init() on the EInternalFrame.
Specified by:
close in interface EDesktopIF
Parameters:
window - is a Ljjb.toolbox.swing.EInternalFrame object reference to the window displayed and targeted to be closed on the desktop.

close

public void close(java.lang.String key)
           throws java.beans.PropertyVetoException
close closes the internal frame in this desktop referred to by the key parameter. NOTE: This method should not be called directly! Instead, call window.setClosed(true); and the EDesktopPane will capture the event, remove the EInternalFrame from the desktop, reset the next & previous EInternalFrame references, and call init() on the EInternalFrame.
Specified by:
close in interface EDesktopIF
Parameters:
key - is a Ljava.lang.String object referring to a window object displayed in this desktop.

next

public void next()
next brings to front the next window in the chain of windows on this desktop. The chain order is determined by the order in which they were added to the desktopy.
Specified by:
next in interface EDesktopIF

open

public void open(EInternalFrame iframe)
CHECKED open adds the internal frame to the desktop referenced by it's title, appended with a count of internal frames opened on this desktop thus far.
Specified by:
open in interface EDesktopIF
Parameters:
iframe - is the Ljjb.toolbox.swing.EInternalFrame object being added and opened on this desktop.

split

public void split(int orientation)
           throws java.beans.PropertyVetoException
split organizes the windows in the desktop by either splitting all visible, non-iconified JInternalFrame windows horizontally or veritcally.
Specified by:
split in interface EDesktopIF
Parameters:
orientation - is a integer specifying the orientation of the split, either Orientation.HORIZONTAL or EDesktopIF.VERTICAL.
Throws:
a - Ljava.beans.PropertyVetoException if the property change for the JInternalFrame is rejected by one of the PropertyChangeListener objects for the JInternalFrame.
